title: Echoes (Pink Floyd song)
summary: "Echoes" is a song by the English rock band Pink Floyd, and the sixth and final track from their 1971 album Meddle. It is 23 and a half minutes long and takes up the entire second side of the original LP. The track was composed by combining a variety of different musical themes and ideas, including instrumental passages and studio effects, resulting in a side-long piece. The music was written by the group, while Roger Waters' lyrics addressed themes of human communication and empathy, which he returned to in later work.
